text:
Bellevue Hospital, First Avenue from 26th to 29th Streets.
This hospital is operated by the city for the poor sick and those picked up in the streets.
It was first opened in 1816. Most of the buildings in the foreground have been demolished,and now new ones erected.
Approximately, 1925.

Ewing Galloway, Photographer.
title: Hospitals - Bellevue Hospital [operated by the city for the poor sick and those picked up in the streets.]

text:
First Ave., east side, south from and including East 26th Street and showing in the foreground, construction of Bellevue Hospital Out Patient Building.

September 10, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

26th Street, south side, east from 431 East 26th Street, east of First Avenue, with Bellevue Hospital buildings at the right. July 24, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

First Ave., west side, north from and including East 26th to, but not including 27th Streets. Note the Empire State Building silhouetted across the skyline.

May 25, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

408-414 East 26th Street, south side, east of First Ave. (right), showing the two buildings of the University Medical College. This view is westward and shows across the cleared corner (S.E.) a portion of Bellevue Medical College. The latter being on the opposite of First Ave., at the S.W. corner of East 26th Street.

September 1937.

George D. Chinn.

First Avenue, south from a point midway between E. 27th and 26th Streets and across the latter. Individuals in the foreground are awaiting an Avenue C Bus at what is its northerly terminus: Bellevue Hospital. The hospital is on the opposite side of this thoroughfare and does not appear, tho the clearance to the south does. Note the gas holders across the roof of the Crippled Institute and the 23rd Street "El" bend in the background.

May 8, 1938.

P.L. Sperr

First Ave., east side, south from East 31st Street and showing extending from East 30th to 26th Streets, the Bellevue Hospital Buildings. That in the foreground is the Psychiatric Clinic and Building.
No. 2 of this set emphasizes the foreground and shows the gasoline station at the S.E. corner of East 31st Street and the garage at the N.E. corner of East 30th Street.

May 8, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

First Ave., east side, south from East 31st Street and showing extending from East 30th to 26th Streets, the Bellevue Hospital Buildings. That in the foreground is the Psychiatric Clinic and Building.
No. 2 of this set emphasizes the foreground and shows the gasoline station at the S.E. corner of East 31st Street and the garage at the N.E. corner of East 30th Street.

May 8, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

East 26th Street, north side, east from a point east of First Avenue, showing units of Bellevue Hospital. The 5 story structure in the center is the Training School for Male Nurses beyond same. At the water's edge is a ward building, while beyond same appears structures on the Greenpoint (Brooklyn) side of the East River. Note at the left the new P.W. A. constructed Administration Building.

May 8, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.

East 26th Street, west across First Avenue, showing features of this Bellevue Hospital sector. A unit of this institution is at the right, the Out Patient Bldg. Across the open corner on the left, appears the College Bldg. In the background is the outstanding New York Life Insurance Co. Bldg.

October 13, 1939

P. L. Sperr
